title: Front Sprocket - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Front Sprocket Removal - D54; D72; DB4; DBB; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ; DT3; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU; DU3; DU4; DUB; DUC; DUY; DZ; DZA
Position the motorcycle on the side stand.
Right hand side panel remove - all D Series except DC and DV
Remove the right hand side panel (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DUB; DTB; DB2; DA2; DTC; DPZ; DU4; DT4; DB4; D64; DP4; D92; DU3; DT3; DP2; DP3; DZ; DBX; DB; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DPA; DP

body.body: Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

body.name: Detach rear brake fluid reservoir citi_1

body.body: Note the routing of the brake switch harness for installation.
Remove the fixings and detach the right hand control plate from the frame.
Bend back the front sprocket lock washer.
Have an assistant sit on the motorcycle, select sixth gear and apply the front brake hard.

body.name: Fit new lock washer front sprocket abni_2

body.body: Remove the front sprocket nut and discard the lock washer.
Set the drive chain adjustment to allow maximum free play in the drive chain.
Note the orientation of the front sprocket for installation.
Disengage the front sprocket from the drive chain and slide it off the output shaft.

Set the drive chain adjustment to allow maximum free play in the drive chain.

Disengage the front sprocket from the drive chain and slide it off the output shaft.
